question: Sophie has 7 jars of frosting in her kitchen cabinet. Each jar of frosting can decorate 13 brownies. Sophie wants to bake enough brownies to use up all of her frosting. If each pan holds 13 brownies, how many pans worth of brownies should she bake?
answer:
She has enough frosting for 7 * 13 = <<7*13=91>>91 brownies.
She needs 91 / 13 = <<91/13=7>>7 pans to bake all of the brownies.
#### 7
